title: Terror attacks call attention to a seemingly impossible problem in France
Philadelphia under curfew as it awaits release of new details in fatal police shooting of Walter Wallace Jr.
description: Philadelphia officials will soon release the 911 call that brought police to their fatal encounter with Walter Wallace Jr.

title: Trump bet against science, and voters are casting judgment
description:
• CNN Poll: Biden holds nationwide advantage
• Opinion: Trump's 'husbands' remark sealed his fate with women
• Analysis: How Covid is sinking Trump's hopes

title: Here's Trump's wildest election prediction
description: President Donald Trump loves to play pundit and make lots of predictions about his own political future. His wildest 2020 prediction, though, is that Republicans will take back the House of Representatives. In his latest episode of The Point, CNN's Chris Cillizza explains why Trump's big bet is a bust.

title: Marcus Rashford scores a hattrick on the pitch and causes the UK government turmoil off it
description: It is not unusual for a footballer to score a hattrick, even on a stage as grand as the Champions League. Although to score three times in 16 minutes is, admittedly, special. That Marcus Rashford achieved such a feat in the same week he, once again, caused turmoil for the UK government is extraordinary.

title: Trump is taking credit for the 'biggest and best' GDP  in American history. Here are the facts
Zeta is picking up momentum and an even faster movement is expected today
description: More than 32 million people are under tropical storm warnings from the Gulf Coast to the mid-Atlantic Thursday morning as former Hurricane Zeta rushes northeast.

title: UK's Labour Party suspends former leader Jeremy Corbyn after anti-Semitism report
description: Britain's main opposition Labour party has suspended its former leader Jeremy Corbyn, in a stunning development that followed the release of a damning report by the UK's human rights watchdog.

title: This Republican senator is taking being pro-Trump to a whole other level
description: Georgia Republican Sen. Kelly Loeffler was apparently on another planet or something during the 2016 presidential race.

title: Suspect shot and arrested by French police in Nice
description: At least two people have been killed in the French coastal city of Nice during a knife attack the local mayor described as a "terrorist attack."

title: Europe tried a scalpel on the second wave. Now it's going back to the sledgehammer
Europe tried a scalpel on the second wave. Now it's going back to the sledgehammer.
description:
• Immunity to Covid 'lingers for months'
• Live updates: US to cross 100,000 daily Covid-19 infections 'at some point' in next couple of weeks, ex-FDA head says

title: There's a new world's longest flight -- with a catch
description: Last week it was the return of the world's longest flight -- Singapore to New York JFK. This week comes another new aviation record: the world's longest flight in a single-aisle aircraft.

title: Atlas push to 'slow the testing down' tracks with dramatic decline in one key state
description: Shortly after joining the White House as President Donald Trump's pandemic adviser, Dr. Scott Atlas launched a quiet effort that seemed counterintuitive to some of his colleagues -- encouraging officials to limit Covid-19 testing mainly to people experiencing symptoms.

title: In photos: Deadly knife attack in Nice
description: Three people were killed in the French coastal city of Nice during a knife attack Thursday at the Notre Dame Basilica.

title: European Central Bank clears way for more stimulus
description: The European Central Bank has signaled that it could provide even more stimulus this year, warning on Thursday of clear risks as the region's two biggest economies once again impose sweeping restrictions in an effort to curb the resurgent coronavirus.

title: Retiring Delta captain meets the air controller whose grandfather hired him
description: During commercial aviation's pandemic downturn, countless veteran airline pilots are retiring to save the jobs of their younger cohorts. But it was during Captain Paul Holmes' final flight for Delta Air Lines that a chance conversation with an air traffic controller brought him back to his early days with the airline.

title: Disneyland Paris shuts down again as France enters lockdown
description: Disneyland Paris is temporarily closing again as France enters a second nationwide lockdown to curb a surge in coronavirus infections.

title: Social media video shows scene near attack in Nice
description: At least two people have been killed in a knife attack in Nice, France according to local mayor Christian Estrosi who described the attack as a "terrorist" incident.

title: Jack Nicklaus endorses Donald Trump ahead of US presidential election
description: Golf great Jack Nicklaus says he has voted for US President Donald Trump and has encouraged other American voters to do the same ahead of next week's election.

title: They call themselves 'Wives of the Deplorables' because their husbands support Trump
description: Carole Catherine did not know her husband, Tim, supported Donald Trump until the day after Hillary Clinton lost the 2016 election. She called him the next morning crying.

title: Rafael Nadal set for Paris return as professional sports in France play on
description: Having recently showcased his golf skills, world No. 2 Rafael Nadal looks set to return to more familiar terrain next week at the Paris Masters after professional sports events were given the green light to go ahead despite France's second national lockdown.

title: Remains of 59 bodies found in clandestine graves in Mexico
description: The remains of 59 bodies have been discovered in clandestine graves in a region of central Mexico that has suffered some of the highest levels of drug violence in recent years, national authorities said on Wednesday.

title: United Airlines to offer free covid testing for passengers on select routes
description: In what could be a glimpse into the future of pandemic air travel, United Airlines will begin offering free coronavirus tests to passengers on select routes. United hopes the move will not only increase traffic on mostly empty transatlantic flights, but also spark international cooperation to break down travel restrictions.

title: David Hockney's most important landscape painting could sell for upwards of $35 million next month
description: David Hockney's 1980 landscape painting "Nichols Canyon" will go on offer at the upcoming Phillips contemporary evening sale, scheduled to take place on December 7th.

title: The NFL is confronting racism, but are Black quarterbacks continuing to be stereotyped?
description: To his frustration, they talked about Patrick Mahomes' arm rather than his decision making as if brawn somehow mattered more than brain.

title: LVMH snags $400 million discount on Tiffany acquisition after legal spat
description: Tiffany has agreed to accept a lower price in its sale to LVMH, ending a dramatic spat that threatened to derail the $16 billion takeover.

title: What it's like to be a cruise ship captain
description: Each evening, whether the Celebrity Edge cruise ship is crisscrossing the Caribbean or meandering around the Mediterranean, Captain Kate McCue writes night orders for her team.

title: The Road to 270: Biden is rewriting the map
description:
• Opinion: Trump's historically bad campaign
• Analysis: We made it to the Friday before Election Day. Here's what to know

title: European countries announce sweeping new Covid-19 restrictions
description: Two of Europe's largest economies -- France and Germany -- have announced sweeping new restrictions as cases of Covid-19 surge. CNN's Jim Bittermann reports.

title: China sent fugitive's elderly father to America to coerce him into going home, US claims
description: The Unites States has charged eight people, including six Chinese citizens, over a three-year plot to intimidate a US resident into returning to China to face criminal charges.

title: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez unveiled as Vanity Fair's latest cover star
description: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez has been unveiled as Vanity Fair's latest cover star, less than a week before she concludes her bid for reelection in New York's 14th congressional district.

title: What will China look like in 15 years? Beijing has a plan
description: The coronavirus pandemic has left governments in disarray and made planning even weeks ahead difficult. In Beijing this week, however, China's leaders met to set specific policy for much of the coming decade.

title: Trump tried to reinvent Middle East policy, but the region is still a bottomless pit of woes
description: All the world's a stage, Shakespeare wrote. But since President Donald Trump came to office, the rest of the world has become a sideshow to the noise and fury emanating from Washington.

title: Food writer serves teeny, tiny tacos to chipmunk
description: Food writer opens "restaurant" for chipmunk featuring miniature dishes. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Sisters allegedly stabbed store security guard 27 times after he told them to wear mask
description:
• Live updates: US 'not in a good place,' Fauci says
• Immunity lingers for months, study finds

title: Legendary chef who brought authentic Chinese food to the US dies
description: San Francisco chef Cecilia Chiang, who blazed a trail for Chinese cuisine in the United States, died Wednesday. She was 100. Her granddaughter, Siena Chiang, confirmed her death with CNN.
